abstract: Picasa 3.5 analyzes the faces of the people in your pictures and groups similar ones together, making it easier to identify people by name for sorting and searching.
snippet: Picasa 3.5 analyzes the faces of the people in your pictures and groups similar ones together, making it easier to identify people by name for sorting and searching.
lead_paragraph: Google’s recent update of its free Picasa photo-editing program now includes the same “name tags” technology first introduced in Picasa Web Albums. With the feature turned on, Picasa 3.5 analyzes the faces of the people in your pictures and groups similar ones together, making it easier to identify people by name for sorting and searching. A tutorial on using Picasa name tags is at Picasa’s help site; Picasa 3.5 itself, which works with recent Windows and Mac OS X systems, can be downloaded at picasa.google.com.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Facial Recognition for Your Photo Album
